type.description:
### ⚠️ Requires [Apugli](https://apugli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) to be installed! ⚠️

## Energy Swirl

---



[Power Type](https://apugli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/power_types/energy_swirl).

Creates a translucent energy swirl around an entity (Similar to a Charged Creeper or a Wither on 50% health or less).

Type ID: `apugli:energy_swirl`

!!! note
    Any `texture_url` specified files have a size limit of 1MB. You are able to change this through the Apugli config.



---
type.markdownDescription:
### ⚠️ Requires [Apugli](https://apugli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) to be installed! ⚠️

## Energy Swirl

---



[Power Type](https://apugli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/power_types/energy_swirl).

Creates a translucent energy swirl around an entity (Similar to a Charged Creeper or a Wither on 50% health or less).

Type ID: `apugli:energy_swirl`

!!! note
    Any `texture_url` specified files have a size limit of 1MB. You are able to change this through the Apugli config.



---

texture_location.description: If specified, the texture used for the energy swirl overlay.
texture_location.markdownDescription: If specified, the texture used for the energy swirl overlay.

texture_url.description: If specified, the url to a .png file imported into the game as a texture for this power's use. This will be used as a fallback if `texture_location` is not specified or if a texture is not present.
texture_url.markdownDescription: If specified, the url to a .png file imported into the game as a texture for this power's use. This will be used as a fallback if `texture_location` is not specified or if a texture is not present.

size.description: The scale relative to the entity at which the energy swirl will render at.
size.markdownDescription: The scale relative to the entity at which the energy swirl will render at.

speed.description: The speed at which the overlay swirls around the player. You can set this to 0 if you want a static overlay.
speed.markdownDescription: The speed at which the overlay swirls around the player. You can set this to 0 if you want a static overlay.
